data.name: White
data.description:
The Shy Sister

This delicate wheat and barley malt beer is the most refreshing of all. Light in color and in taste but with distinctive aromatic undertones that will not leave you indifferent. La Blanche is the shy sister that you must get to know to really appreciate her beauty…

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: South German-Style Hefeweizen / Hefeweissbier
style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. Because yeast is present, the beer will have yeast flavor and a characteristically fuller mouthfeel and may be appropriately very cloudy. No diacetyl should be perceived.

breweries.name: Les 3 Brasseurs
breweries.description:
In a time in Northern France where trucks and commercial transportation were not yet a part of daily life, the process of brewing beer was a very different one than it is today. In small villages across Europe, it was the local brewer that filled the vessels of pubs and cafés with beer made from his own closely guarded recipes. With the advent of industrialization, however, local breweries all but disappeared, bringing to an end the era of the authentic microbrewery.

Twenty years ago, a family of brewers decided to revive the traditions of the past that were deeply rooted in three generations of their family – thus the name The 3 Brewers – “three” for three generations of brewing tradition. The 3 Brewers opened its very first microbrewery restaurant in Place de la Gare à Lille in 1986. Since then operations have expanded to 28 locations in France as well as several restaurants in other parts of the world including Quebec and soon Ontario.

Les 3 Brasseurs' success can be attributed to a unique concept: Fresh non-pasteurized beer made from the purest ingredients and from traditional recipes – all brewed right at the heart of each of our restaurants for patrons to see.

breweries.name: Bayerische Staatsbrauerei Weihenstephan
breweries.description: The Bavarian State Brewery Weihenstephan, founded in 1040, is the oldest existing brewery in the world. As directed by operation of Bavaria it is run as a modern company, which brews beers of the highest quality and successfully sells worldwide in over 40 countries. The unique combination of tradition and science gives the brewer the quality standard "premium bavaricum" and national and international awards for their "Weihenstephan beers."

data.name: White Horse Hefeweizen
data.description: This German inspired wheat ale is packed full of citrus flavor. We use torrified wheat, pale, and carafoam for balance, giving it a nice hazy, straw color and refreshing wheat taste. We ferment the White Horse at higher ale temps with a German style yeast that is known for producing world class wheat beers. We let the yeast take over the majority of the flavoring in our fermenters, providing the beer with banana and clove like esters. We pull some of the yeast with it to give this brew the proper style and to keep its body and character. We than age this brew with zests of citrus and a brewers spice that blends harmoniously with the esters of the yeast and balance out the sweetness of this brew. Truly a favorite in the summer time for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

breweries.name: Roy Pitz Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Where we make the good stuff…
The building where the brewery is located was built in the early 1900′s. It is located on North Third Street within two blocks of the historic square and Franklin County Courthouse in Chambersburg. A three-story, industrial all-brick building consists of 20,000 sq. ft in total area. The brewery is currently located in the basement and is 5,500 sq. ft. of classic brick and old pine timber, which has been restored to its original look and texture.

The brewhouse that christens this humble abode traveled from Anchorage, Alaska. It is a 7 BBL JV Northwest Electric System and is paired with three 20 BBL fermenting tanks allowing Roy Pitz to brew twice a day. At this point, the brewery can brew up to 180 kegs per month at maximum capacity.

data.description: This beer will be strong and a little sweet with a clean finish. Made with German wheat and Vienna malts and Noble Hallertauer hops. This is a great easy drinking beer.

breweries.name: BearWaters Brewing Company
breweries.description: BearWaters Brewing Company is located in Waynesville North Carolina in the beautiful Smoky Mountains of Western North Carolina. BearWaters was named in honor of the region's pristine source of mountain water. BearWaters captures the spirit, traditions and majesty of the Great Smoky Mountains. Come enjoy what happens when fearless creativity, maticulous brewing meets natures greatest natural resource.

breweries.name: Lily's Seafood Grill & Brewery
breweries.description:
Lily's Seafood has been delivering exquisite seafood in a relaxed and comfortable environment since 1999. The Morton brothers opened the restaurant with a passion at heart to bring unique, quality food, perfectly crafted micro-brews and a cozy, relaxed, family friendly atmosphere to downtown Royal Oak . That passion is evident in every dish and pint they serve.

It is in the spirit of the Morton brother's grandmother Lily A. Strange, a Scottish immigrant who brought to this country her love of family, sense of style, and appreciation of fine food that Lily's was created. The Morton brothers have recreated the feeling of their grandparent's home inside the walls of Lily's, tucked into Royal Oak 's vibrant downtown. Lily's is a place to gather and to share not only fine food and drink, but laughter, love, conversation, and fond memories.

data.name: Wiesen Edel Weisse
data.description:
A shiny-brass colored organic wheat beer, certified Naturland organic. An aroma of hops and citrus with a spicy note perfectly balances the malty character with the easiness of the hops. 
Refreshing and full-bodied at the same time.
data.foodPairings: Wonderful with baguette and eggplant cream, marinated salmon with dill or roasted asparagus with tagliatelle.

A unique variety of distinguishing wheat beer specialties is being brewed at Bavaria’s oldest wheat beer brewery strictly following the Reinheitsgebot. The brewer, Georg Schneider VI, presents his family of wheat beer specialties:

Brewing in small batches affords us the opportunity to constantly create new and exciting beers.  Our goal is that each time you visit or taproom, their is a beer available that you haven't tasted before.

data.name: Wild Card Wheat Ale
data.description: A Bavarian style unfiltered wheat beer, also known as Hefe-Weizen. A unique brew with a light color, body & flavor. Wild Card Wheat tastes great complimented by a slice of lemon

breweries.name: Brew Brothers Brewery
breweries.description: Named Best Brewpub in America by Nightclub & Bar magazine, The Brew Brothers offers eight custom microbrews and a creative menu, including gourmet wood-fired pizzas, salads, burgers, ribs, sandwiches, homemade soups and complete dinners. The Brew Brothers Reno brewery was also voted “Best Microbrew, “Best Beer Selection,” and “Best Live Music” in the Best of Reno poll and was named the highest selling brewpub in North America. Catch live bands and DJs nightly.

data.name: Wild Frog Wheat
data.description: Traditional German-style, unfiltered wheat beer, with a lively balanced flavor. Although no fruit or spices were used in the brewing, these flavors are created by fermentation with special yeast from the oldest brewery in the world. Try Wild Frog Wheat with a slice of orange for a crisp, refreshing experience

breweries.name: Hoppin' Frog Brewery
breweries.description:
Hoppin’ Frog is a small, hands-on brewery making very flavorful beers in the most flavorful beer styles. We brew high quality beers with an uncompromising focus on detail, from the ingredient selection to the brewing process. A specially designed JV Northwest brewing system creates more flavorful beers by allowing more barley to be used in the brewing process.  We also use a special bottling machine that keeps the beer fresher, and extends storage times compared to other conventional microbrewery bottling machines. This is very beneficial to retain all the character of these flavorful styles of beer.

Hoppin’ Frog is the concept of owner and established brewmaster Fred Karm, who has designed and produced more award-winning beers than any other professional brewer in Ohio since 2000. All of these awards were won at the 2 most prestigious contests in the world, including the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Cup. Mr. Karm has been a brewer of specialty beers since 1994, a life-long Akron, Ohio resident, and is a graduate of the University Of Akron.

locations.name: The Tasting Room at Hoppin' Frog

data.name: Wild Mary’s Hefeweisen
data.description: Wild as they come, we sometimes say wheat, but this is a classic German weiss. Order a “heff” or a “wheat” and we’ll fill your glass with a light unfiltered ale unlike any we brew. The unique flavor starts with the yeast. Esters form during fermentation that release a banana flavor. We automatically put a lemon wedge on your glass, but ask for an orange and find a whole new set of flavors.

breweries.name: Belle Isle Restaurant and Brewing Co
breweries.description: The Belle Isle Restaurant & Brewery, located in the heart of Northwest Oklahoma City, is a favorite for lunch, dinner and entertainment. Enjoy a menu of pastas, burgers, pizzas, and more. Then there's the Beer! We at the Belle Isle Brewery are proud to create the finest handcrafted beer available, using the best ingredients and strict German Brewing rules. We've developed an excellent selection of beers now available for take out. Our pub features a daily happy hour and live music.

data.name: Wild Wapiti Wheat
data.description: Vibrant and refreshingly light, this Bavarian hefeweizen is packed with lively flavors of citrus, clove, and banana. Its sparkling mouth feel and friendly flavor make a sure hit for any crowd.

breweries.name: Elk Mountain Brewing
breweries.description: Elk Mountain Brewing, Inc., established in April of 2009, is owned and operated by Tom and Marcia Bell. Elk Mountain Brewing is a small scale microbrewery located in the industrial area of Parker, Co, serving truly unique handcrafted microbrews with award winning recipes. Tom Bell is the head brewer with nearly 20 years of experience. Although he brews a variety of beers, his specialty is German beers with a twist. For those non-drinkers we will have homemade Root Beer on tap.

data.name: Wild Warthog HefeWeizen
data.description: True to style German Wheat Beer produced with German grains, hops, and Weinstephan yeast. Expect a light bodied beer with the yeast produced flavors of banana and clove along with a hazy / cloudy appearance due to suspended yeast and wheat protein. Literal translation of the german word hefeweizen is hefe=yeast and weizen=wheat.

breweries.name: Tampa Bay Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Our family founded the Tampa Bay Brewing Company in 1996 to satisfy Tampa Bay’s thirst for a better beer and great food at a reasonable price. It’s still a family affair, with mother and son serving as general manager and brewmaster respectively.
Our original location was a two-story brick building that used to house horses on 15th Street here in the historic Ybor City district.
Needing more space for our ever-growing fan base, we moved to our current location on the plaza level of Centro Ybor in 2006 with both indoor and open-air patio seating.

data.name: Windansea Wheat
data.description: There are wheat beers that need dressing up, and there are those that don’t. Windansea Wheat is the latter. We brew our Hefeweizen true to the Bavarian style, using 50% malted wheat and Noble Tettnanger hops. A centuries old strain of German weissbier yeast lends its trademark banana and clove flavors that linger through a refreshingly smooth finish.  Save the citrus wedge for a beer in need, you’ll thank us.

breweries.name: Karl Strauss Brewing Company
breweries.description: Karl Strauss Brewing Company has pioneered the San Diego beer scene since 1989 with innovative beer releases like Mosaic Session Ale, Big Barrel IIPA, and Wreck Alley Imperial Stout. The brewery has won 67 medals over the past five years and its Red Trolley Ale is one of the most award-winning beers in the world. The company is currently ranked #45 on the list of the country’s top craft breweries with sole distribution in California. For more information visit www.karlstrauss.com or call the brewery at (858) 273-2739. Share it. Cheers.

Because yeast is present, the beer will have yeast flavor and a characteristically fuller mouthfeel and may be appropriately very cloudy. No diacetyl should be perceived.

data.name: Window Tour Hefeweizen
data.description: Rob fell in love with Weiss beers while in Germany a couple years ago. However, it was a business trip, so much of the experience of Germany was through the passenger window of the car at 200 km/hr on the autobahn. With 70% of the grist being wheat, this beer will have a wheaty flavor and the noble hops used in the brewing process are almost undetectable. To avoid the overly banana/apple/pear aroma and flavor sometimes noticed in hefeweizens, we ferment at a lower temperature for a period time then allow the fermentation temperature to naturally rise as energy from the yeast is released. This gives our hefeweizen a great balance of clove and banana so your pallet is completely satisfied.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: South German-Style Hefeweizen / Hefeweissbier

The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. breweries.name: Grist Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Grist Brewing Company is located just south of C-470 and Santa Fe Boulevard across the street from Shea Stadium.

Our focus is simply to make ales and lagers that are of the highest quality, approachable, and true to style. We certainly will experiment, it’s in our nature. However, the primary focus at Grist will be to make consistently great beers to be enjoyed year round.  We balance creativity with science to make great beers.

While striving to make exceptional beer is our passion, we are equally committed to making a positive impact in our community. Rather than saving a couple dollars, Grist made a significant investment in our economy by purchasing a new, American made 20 barrel brewhouse. We feel it’s important to support the community and economy that is going to support us.

breweries.name: Fox River Brewing Company
breweries.description: Dating back to 1846, the city of Oshkosh has deep roots in brewing fine beers http://oshkoshbeertimeline.blogspot.com/. Fox River Brewing Company opened on the Fox River in Oshkosh, late 1995. Under the name of Fratellos (meaning brothers) and Fox River Brewing Co., the Supple Brothers, long-standing restaurateurs, dove into the brewing industry.

data.name: Winter Weisse
data.description: The winter version of our DLG award-winning wheast beer.

style.name: South German-Style Hefeweizen / Hefeweissbier

breweries.name: Familienbrauerei Jacob
breweries.description:
In 1738 the workers of the smelting work in Bodenwöhr requested permission from Karl Albrecht, Elector of Bavaria, to establish a brewhouse so that they would no longer need to import the brews of somewhat inferior quality from nearby towns.
Twenty years later, in 1758, the first master brewer, Peter Still, ultimately was allowed to begin his work beside the Hammersee.
In 1884, Johann Baptist Jacob (the great-grandfather of present-day owner Marcus Jacob) acquired the company. The two generations of the Jacob family that followed upheld his pioneering spirit and iron will to maintain the business to the benefit of quality and the employees.

Reaping the rewards: Jacob wheat beer has been awarded the gold seal by German Agricultural Society (DLG) every year since 1994.

data.name: Wintergreen Weiss
data.description: Bavarian-style Hefeweizen. This 2010 Great American Beer Festival Bronze medal winner is a traditional Bavarian-style wheat beer is hazy gold in color, with a lively fruity finish that has hints of clove and banana. This is the beer that started the odyssey that led to the creation of Devils Backbone Brewing Company. During a ski trip to the Alps, DBBC founder Steve Crandall discovered and fell in love with Hefeweizen. Now we bring Hefeweizen to the Blue Ridge.

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company
breweries.description: 2012 GREAT AMERICAN BEER FESTIVAL SMALL BREWPUB and SMALL BREWPUB BREWER OF THE YEAR & 2010 WORLD BEER CUP CHAMPION BREWERY & SMALL BREWPUB, the award winning Basecamp Brewpub is situated in the majestic valley of the Blue Ridge Mountains with a lodge style atmosphere. We brew authentic craft beer in our brewhouse with a traditional German style brewing system and pour fresh brews daily from 16 taps in the pub area. Our menu specializes in oak wood -fired smoked dishes and local fare. We offer children their own special menu too!  Basecamp is open daily: 11:30pm serving lunch & dinner.

locations.name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company - Outpost
locations.hoursOfOperation: Wednesday & Thursday open 1pm - 7pm.  Friday & Saturday open 1pm - 8pm.  Sunday open 1pm - 6pm

breweries.name: Harriet Brewing
breweries.description: At Harriet Brewing we emphasize intention as the primary component in recipe development. It's what makes good beer special. We take pride in using our knowledge of traditional beer styles, our open minds, and eclectic pallets to brew both unique and traditional beer styles. Our goal with every recipe is authenticity… to develop a particular character that allows the beer to stand out and be remembered. It's authenticity that we crave as beer drinkers; so, it's authenticity that we strive for as brewers. We study beer, determine what we want, then manifest it! For most of us here, it's not just in brewing; it's a way of life.

breweries.name: Hereford & Hops Restaurant and Brewpub
breweries.description: Hereford and Hops opened in downtown Escanaba, on the first floor of a historic 1914 five-story former hotel. The restored building has two dining rooms, a pub and two brick open grills. Since 1994 Hereford and Hops has specialized in a do-it-yourself style of dining with the choice to grill your own steak, seafood or chicken. With grill chefs on duty, you can always choose to have your entrée professionally grilled.

data.name: Woody's Wheat
data.description: Woody's Wheat is a classic hefe-weizen, lightly hopped, with a smooth finish and clove and banana overtones.

breweries.name: Sand Creek Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sand Creek Brewing Company began on a dairy farm in Downing, Wisconsin, about 20 miles northwest of the city of Menomonie. After homebrewing on the family farm for years, homebrewer Cory Schroeder teamed up with Jim Wiesender to found the brewery in 1999.

Using equipment scrounged from various industries, such as a converted pudding tank for the brew kettle, the pair launched a successful business, brewing the beer just steps away from the chicken coop and a busy dairy farm.

Their Sand Creek Golden Ale and English Style Special Ale, available only on draft and in half-gallon growlers, soon developed a reputation throughout Wisconsin's many brew fests. With a capacity of only about 150 barrels per year, the brewery, now with a third owner on board, quickly outgrew the little farm shed converted into a brewhouse.

Hoping to remain in the Dunn/St. Croix counties area, the company looked for a suitable place to relocate, but came up empty handed. Then opportunity knocked in the form of a phone call one evening from their friend in Black River Falls, Pioneer brewing's brewmaster Todd Krueger. The brewery was for sale.

In March of 2004 the combined forces of the two breweries officially formed the new Sand Creek Brewing Co. of Black River Falls, Wisconsin.

data.name: Workingman's Wheat
data.description: Light crisp American style wheat with a medium hop finish. Made using 25% German wheat malt. Brewed and on tap each summer.

breweries.name: Amherst Brewing Company
breweries.description: Amherst Brewing Company is a full-service brewpub located in downtown Amherst, Massachusetts. Our 10-Barrel brewery is visible from the bar and produces some of the finest ales and lagers for serving in our 150-seat restaurant and 100-seat lounge and game room. Brewery tours can be made by appointment. Our giant, brass-top bar seats over 30 people and is fully stocked, including Single Malt Scotches and Small Batch Bourbons. An additional 40 seats are available on our seasonal patio; the best place in town to relax and enjoy an ABC draft or specialty brew while watching passersby. --From Amherst Website

breweries.description: Debuting in 2012, Solemn Oath Brewery features an array of American, Belgo-American, traditional, wood-aged and experimental beer styles. We're excited to join our Illinois craft brethren in providing you with another quality-focused, local option to satisfy your craft beer needs.

data.name: Yuengling Summer Wheat
data.description:
Yuengling Summer Wheat is carefully brewed with a combination of wheat and barley malts. Hallertau hops and Bavarian-style top fermenting yeast deliver a thick, creamy head with overtones of banana and clove esters. This authentic German Weizen style beer, with a slight hazy appearance, concludes with a crisp finish.

Summer Wheat is the third edition to America’s Oldest Brewery’s seasonal offerings and is scheduled to release between Yuengling’s spring release, Bock and fall release, Oktoberfest.

breweries.name: Yuengling Brewery
breweries.description:
Yuengling Brewery  is the oldest operating brewing company in the United States, having been established in 1829, and is one of the largest breweries by volume in the country. It is the second largest American owned brewery after the Boston Beer Company. Its headquarters is in Pottsville, Pennsylvania.

Yuengling produces 3.6 million barrels annually, which as of 2005, placed it sixth among American commercial breweries. Besides its two Pennsylvania facilities, Yuengling also operates a brewery in Tampa, Florida.

The family-owned brewery has traditionally changed ownership through the purchase of the company by the offspring of the previous owner. Due to the popularity of Yuengling Traditional Lager in Pennsylvania, it can be ordered by simply asking for a lager, especially in eastern parts of the state.

Figure Eight Brewing is a small craft brewery located just an hour southeast of Chicago in Valparaiso, Indiana. We believe in making great beer and enjoying life to its fullest.

Our mission is to make great beer and share it. Utilizing the best ingredients while synthesizing classic and innovative brewing styles and techniques, riding on the edge of where beer has gone and where beer is going.
